messages.title: OUR NHS: At risk with the Conservatives
messages.content: Tory Health spokesman accepted £21,000 donation from private health firm boss. David Cameron meets NHS privatisation campaigners. Key Tory MPs backed call to dismantle NHS.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Liberal Democrats will take action to protect frontline NHS services. Will put more police on patrol, restore the pensions' earnings link and deliver fair pay for the armed forces. Identified real savings to pay for it. The only party with a plan to balance the country's books after the recession.

issues.health: The Liberal Democrats will take action to protect frontline NHS services.

leaflet.personalStatement: I am a Londoner born and bred having grown up and studied in the east of the city and currently a councillor in nearby Waltham Forest, where I'm also deputy group leader of the Council's Liberal Democrats.

politicalExperience.role: Councillor in nearby Waltham Forest, Deputy group leader of the Council's Liberal Democrats

quotes.text: We’ve lived through this mistake for 60 years now... The reality is it [the NHS] hasn’t worked - it has made people iller.
quotes.source: Senior Conservative MP Dan Hannan, Summer 2009

quotes.text: Tory Health spokesman accepted £21,000 donation from private health firm boss.
David Cameron meets NHS privatisation campaigners.
Key Tory MPs backed call to dismantle NHS.

images.caption: Johar Khan in front of Southgate Underground station.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Like you, I want to see change here in Southgate. Under a Labour government, people are losing their jobs and businesses, violent crime is on the rise and local NHS services are under threat. The Conservatives talk a good game, but their ideas are rooted in the failed policies of the 1980s, policies for which we continue to pay for today.
